inclusion.criterion: Able and willing to provide written informed consent
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects with a qualifying CDI episode who have a prior history of CDI diarrhea or first occurrence of CDI diarrhea with a higher risk for recurrence (≥ 65 years of age)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: CDI symptoms must have started within 30 days (inclusive) prior to the day of randomization
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The diarrhea is considered unlikely to have another etiology.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Complete an Investigator's choice SOC antibiotic regimen of a minimum of 10 days and up to 21 days of total duration
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have a positive C. difficile stool
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Recovered from any complications of severe or fulminant CDI and clinically stable by the time of randomization.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of diarrhea (defined as 3 or more loose stools per day lasting for at least 4 weeks) that is not related to C. difficile infection within the 3 months prior to randomization.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known or suspected toxic megacolon and/or known small bowel ileus at the time of randomization.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 60-year-old woman with recent history of aspiration pneumonia, febrile, abdominal pain, diarrhea. Stool samples positive for Clostridium difficile toxin.
